articles.title: DPRK Delegation Comes Back Home from ASEAN Meeting
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Comes Back Home from ASEAN Meeting
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun came back home Saturday after attending the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum and visiting Mongolia, Malaysia and Singapore.

articles.title: British Party Official Returns Home
articles.content:
British Party Official Returns Home
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, and his companion flew back home on Saturday after visiting the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Servile Attitude toward Japan Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Servile Attitude toward Japan Censured
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued information bulletin No. 976 Saturday accusing the group of traitors of south Korea of its equivocal attitude towards the Japanese reactionaries' moves to grab territories of Korea and its behavior to calm down the anti-Japanese sentiment of south Koreans of various strata.  
					 It says: 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries recently banned the Japanese public officials from using a south Korean airliner, "protesting" against the plane's test flight over Tok Islets. Assemblymen from the Liberal Democratic Party are mulling visiting Ullung Island. This aroused a strong rebuff from the south Koreans.
					
					 Various civic and public organizations and the Democratic Party, the Democratic Labor Party and other political parties of south Korea held a protest rally outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul, strongly denouncing and rejecting Japan's ambition to seize Tok Islets.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, took passive approach toward Japan, saying that "south Korea should not be embroiled in disputes with Japan" and talking about "silent diplomacy", "regret" and "self-restraint". They are trying to calm down the people's anti-Japanese sentiment, describing the LDP assemblymen's visit to Ullung Island as "tour".
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' recent moves are serious issues not to be tolerated by the Korean nation as they revealed once again their ambition to seize Ullung Island and Tok Islets, inalienable parts of the territory of Korea.
					
					 This is a result of the present south Korean conservative ruling forces' servile diplomacy toward Japan.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group has never taken issue with the Japanese reactionaries whenever they designated Tok Islets as Japan's territory in their defense white paper and distorted history textbooks.  When the Japanese prime minister said that "it cannot but write about Tok Islets in 'new teaching guidelines'" for social subjects at primary and secondary schools, the group asked Japan to "wait," saying that "it finds itself in an embarrassing situation."
					
					 When a south Korean marine institute tried to set up a Tok Islets combined marine research center, the group attempted to delete words Tok Islets from the name of the center, saying that it can rattle the nerves of Japan.
					
					 It is due to the present south Korean ruling forces' servile attitude toward Japan and their treachery to serve it that the Japanese reactionaries are set to visit Tok Islets like their own land and went the lengths of disclosing their territorial ambition on the spot.
					
					 The south Korean group of traitors is taking such ambiguous stand toward the Japanese reactionaries' moves to seize Korea's territories, prompted by its sinister intention to avoid conflict with Japan and strengthen cooperation with it in the moves against the DPRK.
					
					 All facts prove that the south Korean conservative group is made up of the most despicable sycophants and traitors and anti-reunification elements without equals as they are working with bloodshot eyes to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen even giving up the territorial sovereignty of the nation.
					
					  The Koreans will never remain a passive on-looker to the nation's territory being encroached upon and its dignity and interests violated at the hands of the south Korean group of traitors.
					
					 The south Koreans and all other fellow countrymen will never pardon the puppet group kowtowing to outsiders but turn out in the anti-Japanese and anti-"government" struggle to protect the territories of the nation.
					
					 Should the south Korean puppet group persist in escalating the confrontation with the DPRK, selling off the dignity and interests of the nation, it will meet only a shameful destruction.

articles.title: Joint Performance Given by Art Groups of Women's Union
articles.content:
Joint Performance Given by Art Groups of Women's Union
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- A joint performance was given by art groups of women's union organizations across the country at the Central Youth Hall Saturday to mark the 65th anniversary of the promulgation of the law on sex equality.
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, officials and members of the Union in Pyongyang.
					
					 The performance began with chorus "Song of Women," the song conjuring up deep memories. Their repertoire included such colorful numbers as dialogic poem "The Mangyongdae Family and Blessed Women", solo "The General Is Our Father" and poem and story-telling "Women Whom General Knows".
					
					The performers impressively represented the feelings of profound thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il who has led the Korean women to grow up to be proud revolutionaries in the era of Songun, true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung who advanced the Juche-oriented programme for women's emancipation and unrolled a new history of sex equality.

articles.title: Joint Friendly Meeting Held at Int'l Children's Camp
articles.content:
Joint Friendly Meeting Held at Int'l Children's Camp
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- A joint friendly meeting of the 26th batch of campers of the Songdowon International Children's Camp took place at the camp on Saturday.
					 Present there were groups of the DPRK, Chinese, Russian and Tanzanian campers and officials concerned.
					
					 At the end of speeches a colorful art performance was given by campers of the DPRK and other countries.
					
					 The participants danced with joy at pleasant camping, deepening the friendship.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Published
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Published 
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 96 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works". 
					 The book contains the reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung "With the Century" Vol. 2. 
					
					 It deals with the undying feats the President performed by founding the Juche idea, the great guiding idea in the era of independence, thereby indicating the path of the Korean revolution and building the revolutionary armed forces during the period from May of 1930 to February of 1933. 
					
					 The fourth chapter of the reminiscences "Seeking a New Path" deals with the fact that the President laid down the Juche-oriented line for the Korean revolution to follow through a profound inquiry and struggle, thus bringing about a turn in the sacred struggle for national liberation. 
					
					 The fifth chapter of the reminiscences "People in Arms" tells stories the President wisely led the preparations for armed struggle, closely knitting broad masses as a political force.
					
					 The President put forth a policy on organizing and conducting the armed struggle with main emphasis on guerrilla warfare at the meeting of Party and Young Communist Meeting in Mingyuegou around the middle of December 1931. On April 25, 1932 he proclaimed the birth of the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army. 
					
					 Its sixth chapter "The Year of Trials" deals with the fact that the President conducted the expedition to south Manchuria to form the anti-Japanese joint front in the idea of achieving national unity.
					
					  In the chapter he recollected with deep emotion that he overcame a rigorous ordeal with the sense of responsibility for the revolution on the heights of Luozigou during the march to Wangqing, leading 18 guerillas.

articles.title: Fantastic Background Stand of "Arirang"
articles.content:
Fantastic Background Stand of "Arirang"
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Preparations have been finished to give the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang.
					 What is most conspicuous in the extravaganza is the background stand.
					
					 Through ever-changing pictures of the beautiful landscape of the country and the history of its political, military, economic, cultural and social development, the background stand shows the heroic spirit and close unity of the Korean people.
					
					 It, displayed by tens of thousands of schoolchildren, gives explanations of the scenes with letters and pictures.
					
					 It is also used as screen for film scenes suitable for the performance. 
					
					 Many foreigners who enjoyed the annual event before admired kaleidoscopic background arts. The display was so disciplined that some of them thought it was controlled by computer and others went to the stand to confirm schoolchildren's display at first hand after the performance. 
					
					 Ri Jong A, a 16-year-old girl studying at Pyongyang Changgwang Secondary School, told KCNA:
					
					 I am pleased to join in the background stand admired by world people. I will make a good job in this year's performance.
					
					Rim Chol Bom, a 16-year-old secondary school student in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 The background stand has been supplemented with new letters and pictures. So, I used to make some mistakes in practice before. But I am good now.
					
					Song Song Chan, an official in charge of the background stand, said:
					
					 About 20 percent of the background arts have been renewed for this year's performance. I am sure the ever-changing background display, the first of its kind in the world, will enjoy a big applause from spectators.  
					
					 The performance will start on August 1.

articles.title: Law on Sex Equality
articles.content:
Law on Sex Equality
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- July 30 marks the 65th anniversary of the promulgation of the law on sex equality in Korea.
					 President Kim Il Sung promulgated the "Law on Sex Equality in North Korea" on July 30, Juche 35 (1946), two years before the founding of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The law serves as guidelines for emancipation of women and a code based on respect for women.
					
					 From the early period of his revolutionary days, the President had paid close attention to the issue of women and rallied them in organizations.
					
					 In "The Ten-point Program of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland" released during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, the President indicated a clear-cut way for realizing sex equality. In the period of building of a new society, he took the women's social emancipation as a main task to be fulfilled during the anti-imperialist, anti-feudal democratic revolution. 
					
					 In November 1945, soon after the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, he organized the Democratic Women's Union of North Korea, a genuine political organization of women.
					
					Now the Korean women are living a worthwhile life and enjoying respect in society under deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Some of them are heroes, celebrated scientists and famous artistes.

articles.title: Women Called upon to Demonstrate Revolutionary Stamina in Building Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Women Called upon to Demonstrate Revolutionary Stamina in Building Thriving Nation
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The promulgation of the law on sex equality marked an event of a great significance as it brought about a fundamental change in the destiny of the Korean women who had long been subject to social subjugation and inequality with no political rights guaranteed.
					 Papers here Saturday say this in editorials dedicated to the 65th anniversary of the promulgation of the law.
					
					Rodong Sinmun says that the Korean women have reposed absolute trust in President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il with high loyalty and devotedly defended the country with transparent faith in the victory of socialism for the past 65 years.
					
					 They have also devoted their all to the future of the revolution, the society and the collective.
					
					 They have never thought about their own life apart from the leader and the embrace of the party.
					
					 Lots of young women are glorifying their lives as human bullets and bombs on the anti-imperialist military front and as pace-setters in the drive for effecting a great surge.
					
					 The revolutionary mothers of the DPRK are giving a steady continuity to the generation of the nation and the revolution by providing them with mental pabulum and putting them forward before the party, the leader, the country and the people.
					
					 They could unswervingly follow the path of the revolution with indomitable faith and strong will thanks to the wise leadership of the President and Kim Jong Il.
					
					Minju Joson notes it was the shining tradition of the Korean women that they displayed ardent patriotic devotion in the history of the drive for a great surge, deeming it happiness to work for the prosperity of the country. The paper calls on them to give fuller play to their revolutionary stamina in the on-going onward movement for a great surge.

articles.title: Declaration on Situation for Peace and Reunification of Korean Peninsula Published
articles.content:
Declaration on Situation for Peace and Reunification of Korean Peninsula Published
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Elders of organizations of different circles of south Korea published a declaration on the situation for peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula on July 27, the 58th anniversary of the conclusion of the armistice agreement. They included Paek Rak Chong, honorary professor at Seoul National University, Paek Ki Wan, director of the Unification Study Center, Kim Sang Gun, director general of the Meeting for Embracing National Reunification, O Jong Ryol, permanent advisor to the Solidarity for Progress.
					 58 years have passed since the armistice agreement was signed but pain and wounds caused by the disastrous war in the Korean Peninsula have not yet been healed but the danger of war is increasing day by day, the declaration said.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that it is necessary to denuclearize the peninsula and conclude a peace agreement through dialogue and negotiations, it noted.
					
					 It called for positively opting for implementing the south-north joint declarations and approach inter-Korean dialogue without condition.
					
					 It also called for getting the "May 24 step" which blocked exchange and cooperation between the south and the north retracted at once.
					
					 The peace-keeping mechanism not helpful to basically defusing the discord caused by division can never be solid, it said. In order to realize a genuine peace it is necessary to reunify the country at an early date.
					
					 They will make the August 15 meeting for independent reunification this year a platform for punishing the Lee Myung Bak regime and the "Grand National Party" seriously threatening the people's rights to existence and the peace in the Korean Peninsula, the declaration said, calling upon the people from all walks of life to turn out in the actions to do so.

articles.title: S. Korean Youth and Students Called upon to Take Lead in Actions for Peace
articles.content:
S. Korean Youth and Students Called upon to Take Lead in Actions for Peace
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a press conference in Seoul on July 27 at which it published a resolution calling on them to take the lead in the actions to achieve the peace in the Korean Peninsula.
					 At a time when the dangerous situation deciding a war or peace is prevailing in the peninsula, building a peace-keeping mechanism presents itself as a very important and urgent issue, the resolution said.
					
					 The armistice agreement should be replaced by a peace agreement, it said, calling upon the youth and students to take the lead in the actions for achieving peace in the peninsula.
					
					 Any act of inciting a war on the part of the separatist forces denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, would never be tolerated, it stressed.

articles.title: Downpours Cause Casualties in S. Korea
articles.content:
Downpours Cause Casualties in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Downpours hit south Korea, causing big damage, south Korean CBS reported.
					 48 persons were killed, 15 others reported missing and many others wounded in Seoul, Kyonggi Province, south Korean Kangwon Province and other areas as of July 28.
					
					 Many farmlands and more than 1,370 dwelling houses were inundated and roads destroyed in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Plane Crashes in S. Korea
articles.content:
Plane Crashes in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- A plane belonging to the Asiana Airlines of south Korea crashed in the waters near Jeju Island on July 28, according to south Korean MBC.

articles.title: DPRK Books Donated to Germany
articles.content:
DPRK Books Donated to Germany
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK books were donated to Germany with due ceremony on July 22.
					 Present at the ceremony were members of the Thuringen State Committee of the Communist Party of Germany and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Berlin.
					
					 Works of President Kim Il Sung and other Korean books were handed over to the chairman of the state committee.
					
					 The chairman said in a speech that the works of the President would be greatly helpful to studying the originality of his ideology and theories and politics of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They would deepen the study of the Juche idea among party members with the centenary of birth of the President as an occasion, he stressed.

articles.title: Benin President Supports Just Cause of DPRK Government and People
articles.content:
Benin President Supports Just Cause of DPRK Government and People
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The government and people of Benin support the DPRK government and people in their just cause.
					 Thomas Boni Yayi, president of Benin, said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Jong Hak Se on July 22.
					
					 Recalling that the two countries have closely supported and cooperated with each other, the president noted that the Benin people express thanks to the Korean people for their disinterested assistance.
					
					 It is the firm will of the Benin government to further develop the friendly relations between the two countries, he stressed.

articles.title: Day of Korean People's Victory in Fatherland Liberation War Marked in DR Congo
articles.content:
Day of Korean People's Victory in Fatherland Liberation War Marked in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Republic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association on July 23 issued a bulletin on the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The bulletin carried articles titled "Reply of Korea" and "Fighting way Korea did" with photos on the invincible might of the Korean People's Army, a panoramic view of Pyongyang and the disgraceful defeat of the U.S. in the Korean War.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung beat back the sudden invasion by the aggressors, went over to an immediate counter-attack to liberate Seoul, the citadel of the enemy, in just three days after the outbreak of war, thus breaking the precedent in the world history of wars, the articles said, adding: The President led the operation to liberate Taejon to victory, setting a brilliant example in the modern battle of encirclement.
					
					 He also taught the tunnel warfare, the aircraft hunting team movement, the tank hunting team movement and other superb military war methods suited to the characteristics of the modern warfare in the Fatherland Liberation War, working such miracle as defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, the articles noted.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by British Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on July 16 posted on its Internet homepage an article illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung on the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The U.S. imperialists ignited a war of aggression against the DPRK in 1950 by mobilizing huge armed forces, the article said.
					
					 The victory of the Korean people in the Korean War was a shining fruition of the wise leadership of the President and the ideological and mental might of all the servicepersons and people who were linked with their leader by the common destiny, it noted.
					
					 The Korean people won a brilliant victory in the life-and-death showdown with the U.S. and its followers, thus honorably defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and protecting security and peace of mankind, it stated.
					
					 Progressive mankind is highly praising the feats the President performed by winning the victory in the war with profound reverence for him who defeated the U.S. imperialists in the Fatherland Liberation War and protected the peace and justice of the world, it pointed out.
					
					The President's feats in winning the victory in the war will last forever thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il who has successfully carried forward the great ever-victorious traditions, it stressed.

articles.title: CPLA Defends Country and Its People and Steps up Economic and Social Development
articles.content:
CPLA Defends Country and Its People and Steps up Economic and Social Development
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- August 1 marks the 84th anniversary of the founding of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					 Over the 84 years since the founding the CPLA has successfully discharged its honorable mission as protector of the country and its people and powerful builder under the leadership of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 The soldiers of the CPLA saved people from disasters in the campaigns to recover from various natural disasters.
					
					In recent two years alone, they participated in the campaigns to eradicate the aftermaths of serious natural disasters including damage done by the severest drought in the southwestern areas, damage caused by heavy snow in the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, damage caused by flood in southern and northeastern areas and the biggest-ever landslides in Zhuqu, Gansu Province. Through these campaigns they rescued or evacuated a total of 310,000 inhabitants.
					
					 During the massive earthquakes in Xingtai, Haicheng, Tangshan and Wenchuan well known to the world, they performed the feats to go down in the world history.
					
					 They took an active part in social construction and built many structures for the country and the people.
					
					 The four-forked long road linking various provinces and autonomous regions, the waterways in Huaihe Haihe Liaohe ad other irrigation facilities built in various areas, the Three Gorges Dam on the Yangtze River, the natural gas pipeline and transmission line transiting from the west area to the east area of the country, the         railways, stadiums and gymnasiums for the Beijing Olympiad, etc. are the product of their devoted efforts.
					
					 In recent years they participated in the drive to modernize the old industrial bases in the northeastern areas and carried out 828 projects.
					
					 They are now performing fresh feats in the work to defend the country and its people and push forward the economic and social development.

articles.title: US Considers Adjusting Korea Policy: Newspaper
articles.content:
US Considers Adjusting Korea Policy: Newspaper
						
 Beijing, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Daily carried an article titled "Trend of DPRK-U.S. Relations Draws Attention" on Thursday.
					 The opening of talks between the DPRK and the U.S. is the former's persistent effort to have bilateral talks. It also implies that the U.S. position concerning the Korean nuclear issue has been eased to some degree.
					
					 The DPRK already informed the UN Security Council of its nuclear research and is now expressing a good will through escalating diplomatic arbitration.
					
					 Above all, it is foiling the UN Security Council's resolutions No. 1718 and No. 1874 calling for sanctions against the country through improved relations and cooperation with neighboring nations.
					
					 From the practical point of view, a closed-door contact channel remains open between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 With both military and economic sanctions failing to prove effective, the U.S. has begun to consider policy adjustment.
					
					 The DPRK, availing itself of the talks, may launch an open-hearted and feasible exchange with the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. formal invitation of a DPRK official to visit the country shows that the DPRK's long-time effort has scored some results.

articles.title: Test Dive of Manned Submersible in China
articles.content:
Test Dive of Manned Submersible in China
						
 Beijing, July 29 (KCNA) -- China on July 26 tested the dive of Jiaolong, China's manned submersible.
					 Jiaolong reached a depth of 5,038.5 meters, successfully carrying out its attempt to reach 5,000 meters.
					
					 The submersible is expected to have a 7,000-meter test dive in 2012.

articles.title: Satellite Launched in China
articles.content:
Satellite Launched in China
 Beijing, July 29 (KCNA) -- China on July 27 successfully launched the ninth Beidou navigation satellite into the expected orbit.
					 The satellite was launched on a Long March-3C carrier rocket at the Xichang Satellite Launch Center.

articles.title: Russian President Supports TV Music Channels for Young People
articles.content:
Russian President Supports TV Music Channels for Young People
 Moscow, July 29 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently voiced support for the plan to telecast Russian music for young people through music channels. 
					 TV will remain long as a main means for young people to get information, he said.
					
					 He underlined the need to introduce Russian culture through TV and Internet.

articles.title: Russian President Calls for Modern Polling Means
articles.content:
Russian President Calls for Modern Polling Means
 Moscow, July 29 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev on Wednesday called for installing modern polling means for this year's Duma election.
					 Parliament election is always a serious and acute political struggle, he said. Public confidence in election results and in the government depends on the professional quality and integrity of election committees.
					
					 He said modern polling means should be installed in some 5,000 constituencies of all federal subjects and that the electronic ballot counting system should be a basis of making all manners of interference impossible and ensuring legitimacy.

articles.title: UK Urged to Reexamine Attitude toward Iran
articles.content:
UK Urged to Reexamine Attitude toward Iran 
						
 Tehran, July 29 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi urged UK to reexamine its attitude toward Iran.
					 Speaking to Iran's official news agency IRNA, the minister said his country is seeking reopening of relations with other countries through dialogue held on an equal footing.
					
					 The lifting of sanctions against Iran's companies may be a positive signal for the British government in reexamining diplomatic ties with Iran, he added.

articles.title: Sri Lanka Refutes British TV Misinformation
articles.content:
Sri Lanka Refutes British TV Misinformation
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The Sri Lankan military spokesman on Thursday refuted a British TV station's misinformation.
					 The British Channel 4 aired a video on Wednesday that they witnessed two Sri Lankan soldiers killing civilians and rebels who had surrendered during the war.
					
					 In the video the soldiers claimed that they were ordered by top officials.
					
					 Speaking to a news agency, the spokesman said the two soldiers appearing in the video were not from the army and that the video was fabricated and false.

articles.title: Algeria Challenges US for Report on Human Trafficking
articles.content:
Algeria Challenges US for Report on Human Trafficking
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- A spokesman of the Foreign Ministry of Algeria in an interview with a news agency Monday scathingly accused the U.S. of the wrong behavior.
					 Claiming that Algeria does not fully comply with the minimum standards for the elimination of human trafficking, the U.S. Department of State ranked Algeria on the blacklist of human trafficking violators. The spokesman said it "is based on erroneous and unreliable" information.
					
					 The local codes and legislatives stipulate sanctioning all kinds of crimes related to the international criminality, he stressed.

articles.title: Hamas Exposes Israeli Sinister Intention
articles.content:
Hamas Exposes Israeli Sinister Intention
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Islamic Hamas movement in a press conference on Monday disclosed the sinister intention of Israel.
					 The Israeli authorities recently claimed that more arms are smuggled from neighboring Arab countries to the enclave.
					
					 The Israeli claim that arms smuggling to the Gaza Strip has recently increased is aimed at justifying a new aggression on Gaza, the spokesman said.
					
					 Israel can never hide its crimes, he stressed.

articles.title: Kazakhstan Accuses US of Unilateral Step
articles.content:
Kazakhstan Accuses US of Unilateral Step
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Kazakhstan recently criticized the U.S. for unilaterally terming the Asian nation a sponsor of terrorism. 
					 It expressed deep concern about the fact that U.S. Department of Homeland Security included Kazakhstan in the list of sponsors of terrorism. 
					
					 Asking what standards the U.S. is based on to work out the list, the Foreign Ministry said Kazakhstan has greatly contributed to forming effective organizations to battle international terrorism and ensuring world security.
					
					 It urged the U.S. to take immediate steps to save the situation.

articles.title: Businesses' Profit Falls in US, Japan
articles.content:
Businesses' Profit Falls in US, Japan
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- U.S. carrier United Continental's profit fell 11.9 percent in the second quarter of the year, as compared with the first quarter, the company recently quoted survey data as saying. 
					 Meanwhile, Canon Inc. of Japan reported a 12.2 percent decline in net profit for the six months to June.

articles.title: Myanmar Builds More Hotels
articles.content:
Myanmar Builds More Hotels 
						
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Myanmar plans to build over 50 hotels as part of preparations for the 27th Southeast Asian Games to be held in 2013.
					 The project is now going on in the country, said Myanmar's news agency on Tuesday.

articles.title: Natural Damage in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Damage in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- A tropical storm swept the Luzon region of Philippines recently, causing damage.
					 The storm, accompanied by heavy rains, left 25 people dead and 31 missing as of July 27, affecting nearly 650,000 people.
					
					 On Monday a 6.2-magnitude earthquake jolted New Ireland of Papua New Guinea while a quake measuring 5.2 magnitude on the Richter scale hit the Marmara Sea of Turkey.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia acto projaponés y vendepatria del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia acto projaponés y vendepatria del Sur de Corea 
Pyongyang, 30 de julio (ACNC) -- El Secretariado del Comité por la Reunificación Pacífica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo pública el día 30 la información no. 976, con respecto a que la banda de traidores surcoreanos intenta apaciguar el ambiente antijaponés de los habitantes de distintos estratos tratando con perplejidad las maniobras de usurpación territorial de los reaccionarios japoneses.
					El texto completo del documento sigue abajo:
					
					En estos días, los reaccionarios japoneses hablan tanto de la "protesta" acusando el vuelo de prueba de un avión de pasajeros del Sur de Corea en el espacio aéreo del islote Tok. En este contexto, prohíben a los oficinistas de su país usar aviones surcoreanos de pasajeros y los parlamentarios del Partido Democrático Liberal de Japón intentan visitar la isla Ullung, provocando gran repudio de la población surcoreana. 
					
					Las entidades civiles y sociales y los partidos políticos del Sur de Corea incluso el Partido Democrático y el Partido de Obreros Democráticos sostuvieron un mitin de protesta frente a la embajada de Japón acreditada en el Sur de Corea para denunciar y rechazar la ambición de Japón de usurpar el islote Tok. 
					
					Pero, las autoridades surcoreanas toman una actitud pasiva diciendo que "no debemos involucrar en el conflicto con Japón" y hablando de la "diplomacia silenciosa", "lástima" y "control de sí mismas". Además, intentan apaciguar el ambiente antijaponés de los habitantes de distintos estratos describiendo la visita a la isla Ullung de los parlamentarios del Partido Democrático Liberal de Japón como un "turismo". 
					
					El presente caso muestra otra vez la ambición de los reaccionarios japoneses de apoderarse de la isla Ullung y el islote Tok, territorios propios de la nación coreana. Pues, es un problema de suma importancia nacional que nunca puede ser tolerado. 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses se obstinan cada vez más en su "soberanía sobre el islote Tok" estimulados por la diplomacia de sumisión a Japón que practican actuales gobernantes conservadores del Sur de Corea.  Si bien aquellos habían anotado muchas veces el islote Tok como territorio japonés en su carta blanca de defensa y tergiversado el manual de historia, los últimos nunca lo han cuestionado. 
					
					Cuando el premier japonés expresó la decisión de incluir en la "nueva guía de estudio" de las asignaturas sociales de escuelas primarias y secundarias los párrafos sobre el islote Tok, le suplicaron que "esperara porque no era el momento de admitirlo". 
					
					Y cuando el Instituto Marítimo del Sur de Corea trataba de instalar la base científica marítima combinada del islote Tok, pretendieron omitir de su nombre la palabra "islote Tok" diciendo que eso puede ofender a Japón. 
					
					Estimulados por tal posición vendepatria y servil a Japón, los reaccionarios japoneses entran libremente en el islote Tok exponiendo su ambición de usurpar este territorio coreano. 
					
					La actitud embarazosa de traidores surcoreanos ante tales tentativas de reaccionarios japoneses parte de su siniestra intención de evitar las contradicciones con los segundos y estrechar la cooperación con Japón en las campañas anti-RPDC. 
					
					Todos los hechos muestran claramente que los conservadores surcoreanos son vendepatrias y opositores a la reunificación, nunca vistos, que se entregan a la confrontación fratricida renunciando hasta la territorialidad de la nación. 
					
					Todos los coreanos no se quedarán con brazos cruzados ante la violación de territorialidad, dignidad e intereses nacionales por culpa de traidores surcoreanos.
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos de distintos estratos y otros integrantes de la nación no perdonarán nunca a la banda de títeres surcoreanos, que comente actos antinacionales adulando a las fuerzas extranjeras, sino se levantarán en la lucha antijaponesa y anti-títeres por defender la integridad territorial. 
					
					Si esa camarilla sigue persiguiendo el enfrentamiento con la RPDC vendiendo la dignidad y los intereses de la nación, no buscarán otra cosa que su vergonzoso arruinamiento.

articles.title: Ceremonia de donación de libros coreanos en Alemania
articles.content:
Ceremonia de donación de libros coreanos en Alemania
						
Pyongyang, 30 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el día 22 en Alemania la ceremonia de donación de libros coreanos.
					En la ocasión estuvieron presentes los miembros del Comité del Partido Comunista de Alemania en Estado Thuringen y los integrantes de la embajada coreana acreditada en aquel país europeo.
					
					Las obras del Presidente Kim Il Sung y otros libros coreanos fueron entregados al presidente de dicho comité.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra en el acto, el presidente del comité dijo que las obras del Presidente contribuirán mucho a estudiar la originalidad de la idea y teoría de él y las políticas del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Manifestó la voluntad de profundizar el estudio sobre la idea Juche entre los militantes de su partido con motivo del centenario de nacimiento del Presidente.

articles.title: Ofrecida función de grupo artístico nacional de UMDC
articles.content:
Ofrecida función de grupo artístico nacional de UMDC 
						
Pyongyang, 30 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 65º aniversario de la promulgación de la ley de igualdad de derechos del hombre y la mujer, tuvo lugar el día 30 en la Casa Central de la Juventud la función del grupo artístico nacional de la Unión de Mujeres Democráticas de Corea. 
					La presenciaron el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, la presidenta del CC de la UMDC, Ro Song Sil, las funcionarias y miembros de la UMDC en esta capital. 
					
					En la escena se pusieron diversas piezas como el coro "Canción de la mujer", la poesía en diálogo "Los familiares de Kim Il Sung en Mangyongdae y las mujeres benditas", el solo "El General es nuestro padre" y la poesía y narración "Mujeres en memoria del General". 
					
					Los ejecutantes describieron bien el sentimiento de infinito agradecimiento al Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quien en acato al noble propósito del Presidente, quien presentó el autóctono programa de liberación de las mujeres y allanó una nueva historia de igualdad del hombre y la mujer, forma a las mujeres coreanas como fidedignas revolucionarias de la época del Songun.

articles.title: Pizarra humana de "Arirang"
articles.content:
Pizarra humana de "Arirang"
						
Pyongyang, 30 de julio (ATCC) -- En el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo quedó completada la función gimnástico-artística masiva "Arirang", que asombra a todo el mundo.
					Especialmente la pizarra humana redobla la admiración de esta obra maestra mostrando sucesivamente las escenas que describen el proceso histórico del desarrollo social, o sea, de la política, los asuntos militares, la economía, la cultura, etc., lo cual posibilita a los espectadores conocer bien del ímpetu heroico y del poderío de la unidad monolítica de la Corea del Songun que avanza a pasos firmes hacia el porvenir radiante.
					
					Cada vez que decenas de miles de ejecutantes, sentados al otro lado de la tribuna, abren y cierran al momento a la vez las letras de distintas formas y colores y diversas imágenes alusivas a los niños jugando y otros dibujos.
					
					Si ellos abren los planos blancos, éstos se cambian de repente en una grandísima pantalla de proyección fílmica atrayendo a los espectadores al mundo misterioso.
					
					Luego de presenciar la función de "Arirang", numerosos extranjeros se asombran ante el milagro de la pizarra humana y algunos de ellos acuden a la pizarra humana para verla con sus propios ojos.
					
					La pizarra humana la hacen los alumnos de las escuelas secundarias.
					
					Citada por la ACNC, la alumna de la Escuela Secundaria Changgwang de Pyongyang, Ri Jong A (16 años de edad) dijo: me siento feliz por ser una integrante de la pizarra humana. Cumpliré con éxito mi encargo en esta función.
					
					El alumno de la Escuela Secundaria Kwangbokuicholligil de Pyongyang, Ri Chol Bom (16 años de edad) destacó: esta vez, algunos dibujos y letras fueron enmendados, razón por la cual al principio me fallé en la práctica, pero ahora son perfectos mis encargos.
					
					El jefe del gabinete de creación de pizarra humana del comité preparatorio nacional de la función, Song Song Chan (52 años de edad) señaló: 
					
					  Quedó enmendado y añadido más o menos el 20% del contenido de la pizarra humana.
					
					La pizarra humana de "Arirang" de Corea, por la coincidencia de las acciones e incontables dibujos que se cambian ininterrumpidamente, provocará gran admiración de los espectadores.
					
					La presente función comenzará el día primero de agosto que viene.
